headline.main: SMOKING AT WORK: POLICIES ARE SOUGHT

docs.lead_paragraph: WHAT smoking policies do Nestle's 950 staff members want for their new corporate headquarters in Harrison? About 300 hundred of the employees took less than 24 hours recently to respond to a corporate survey and demand that smoking be restricted. A total of 600 responded in a week. ''Most of these employees felt it necessary for the company to develop new policies on smoking and not leave it up to employees,'' said Beth MacKay, the manager of personnel administration. She added: ''Nestles certainly plans to use the results of this survey to develop a smoking policy.''

headline.main: 'GIMME SELTZER,' ON 13, A STUDY OF ALCOHOL ABUSE

docs.lead_paragraph: APART from its too-cute title, ''Gimme Seltzer,'' which someone forgot to replace with a more appropriate one to fit the sobering subject of alcohol abuse, tonight's edition of ''Currents'' (8:30, Channel 13) is straightforward and convincing. A lot of information is packed into this week's half-hour program, which follows its familiar format of a documentary plus a roundtable discussion. There are 12 million alcoholics in the country. Nevertheless, alcohol consumption is down 11 percent in the last 10 years, bar business is down 25 percent, nearly half the people polled said they drank less than they did five years ago. Instead, adults seem to be drinking substitutes for the hard stuff: Perrier water, soda, light beer or no-beer and, yes, seltzer. Some of the drinks are called ''mocktails.''
